column1:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than B (Score 2)
column2:
Title: Summary comparison - relevance and accuracy policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary is more relevant and accurate to the specific query.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary is more relevant and accurate to the specific query.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly more relevant and accurate than B (Score: -2)
A slightly more relevant and accurate than B (Score: -1)
Both summaries are equally relevant and accurate (Score: 0)
B slightly more relevant and accurate than A (Score: 1)
B significantly more relevant and accurate than A (Score: 2)

Note: Consider the direct addressing of the specific concerns expressed in the reference text to determine relevance and accuracy.

Revised Explanation for Incorrect Labels:
The agent should evaluate the summaries based on their direct alignment with the primary concern expressed in the reference text. If a summary addresses the specific concern accurately, it should be scored higher, regardless of the broader relevance of the other summary. Additionally, the agent should prioritize the direct addressing of the specific concerns over general information related to the query.
